required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pulmonary Toxicities Related to PARP Inhibitors (PulmonaRIB)
clinical_study.official_title: Pulmonary Toxicities With PARP Inhibitors in Cancer Patients: an Observational and Retrospective Study Using the WHO Pharmacovigilance Database (PulmonaRIB)

brief_summary.textblock:
Although PARP inhibitors (PARPi) have proved effective in treating many cancers, few patients receiving PARPi may experience rare but serious (or not) adverse events such as pulmonary toxicities whose data are scarce.
The objective was to investigate reports of pulmonary toxicities related to PARPi, including olaparib, rucaparib, niraparib, talazoparib, veliparib and pamiparib using the World Health Organization's (WHO) pharmacovigilance database: VigiBase.

detailed_description.textblock: Here, investigators use the World Health Organization's (WHO) database of individual safety case reports, to identify cases of pulmonary toxicities related to PARPi.

primary_outcome.measure: Pulmonary toxicities reports related to PARPi.
primary_outcome.description: Identification of the pulmonary toxicities adverse event related to PARP inhibitors reported in the World Health Organization's (WHO) database of individual safety case reports.

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the latency period since first PARPi exposure
Description of patients who experienced co-reported adverse events

arm_group.description: All patients treated at least with 1 PARPi

intervention.intervention_name: olaparib, rucaparib, niraparib, talazoparib, veliparib, pamiparib
intervention.description: All patients treated at least with 1 PARPi (alone or in combination)

study_pop.textblock: Cancer patients treated with PARPi and experiencing pulmonary toxicities.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- case reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) database (VigiBase) of individual safety case reports at the time of the extraction,
- patients treated with at least 1 PARPi (with ATC classification system): olaparib (ATC L01XX46), niraparib (ATC L01XX54), rucaparib (ATC L01XX55), talazoparib (ATC L01XX60), veliparib (none) and pamiparib (none).
Exclusion Criteria:
-chronology not compatible between the PARPi and adverse event
